meanings.definition: Extremely dark or black in color.
meanings.sent1: The night sky was the inkiest black I had ever seen.
meanings.sent2: The inkiest shadows lurked in the corners of the room.
meanings.sent3: The inkiest cat in the neighborhood was named Midnight.
meanings.sent4: Her hair was as inkiest as a raven's wing.
meanings.sent5: The inkiest paint on the canvas created a sense of mystery.

meanings.definition: Superlative form of 'inky', relating to the color of ink.
meanings.sent1: The inkiest pen in the set wrote the smoothest.
meanings.sent2: Her favorite pen had the inkiest shade of blue.
meanings.sent3: The inkiest ink on the paper made her handwriting stand out.
meanings.sent4: The inkiest stain on his shirt was from a leaky pen.
meanings.sent5: The inkiest lines in the drawing added depth and contrast.

meanings.definition: Having the darkest shade of ink.
meanings.sent1: The inkiest part of the painting was the signature in the corner.
meanings.sent2: The inkiest letters on the page were almost illegible.
meanings.sent3: The inkiest spot on the paper was where the ink had pooled.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes held the inkiest depths of emotion.
meanings.sent5: The inkiest tones in the photograph captured the mood perfectly.
